required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Short and Long-term Safety of Micafungin and Other Parenteral Antifungal Agents
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Cohort Study of the Short and Long-term Safety of Micafungin and Other Parenteral Antifungal Agents

collaborator.agency: World Health Information Science Consultants, LLC

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This multicenter observational cohort study proposes to establish the risks of short and long-term outcomes in users of parenteral micafungin and in users of other parenteral antifungal agents from 2005 through 2012 with follow-up until 2017.

detailed_description.textblock: All eligible patients treated with a parenteral antifungal agent at any time during the years 2005-2012 in each of the participating hospitals, will be included in the study.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after termination of the index treatment
primary_outcome.description: Data will be used of patients treated during the years 2005-2012 with a parenteral antifungal agent in the participating centers.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after termination of the index treatment
primary_outcome.description: Data will be used of patients treated during the years 2005-2012 with a parenteral antifungal agent in the participating centers.

primary_outcome.measure: Rehospitalization for the parenteral treatment of fungal infections
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after termination of the index treatment
primary_outcome.description: Data will be used of patients treated during the years 2005-2012 with a parenteral antifungal agent in the participating centers.
On a long-term basis up to 13 years from 2005-2017.

intervention.other_name: caspofungin, anidulafungin, fluconazole, itraconazole, voriconazole, amphotericin B (various formulations)

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated with parenteral antifungals in tertiary referral centers across the United States.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- hospitalized and treated with parenteral antifungal medication
- first time treatment of the patient with parenteral antifungal in the medical center was anytime from 2005 through 2012
Exclusion Criteria:
- prior diagnosis of hepatocellular carcinoma
- had received parenteral antifungal therapy during the 6 months prior to index hospitalization

facility.name: University of Michigan Hospital and Health System
University of Pennsylvania Office of Research Services
